title: Erek Barron
deleted: In 2013, Barron was recruited by the American Bar Association Death Penalty Representation Project to handle, pro bono, the appeal in ''Isaiah McCoy v. State of Delaware,'' in which McCoy was convicted of capital murder and sentenced to death. On appeal before the Delaware Supreme Court, the Court decided, unanimously, to reverse McCoy's convictions and death sentence based on prosecutorial misconduct and voir dire error.<ref>{{cite web |title=Isaiah W. McCoy v. State of Delaware |url=https://courts.delaware.gov/opinions/download.aspx?ID=217920 |website=courts.delaware.gov |publisher=The Delaware Judiciary |access-date=July 26, 2021 |date=January 20, 2015}}</ref> The original prosecutor on the case was suspended for his misconduct in the case.<ref>{{cite web |title=Matter of a Member of the Bar: Favata |url=https://courts.delaware.gov/opinions/download.aspx?ID=227320 |website=courts.delaware.gov |publisher=The Delaware Judiciary |access-date=July 26, 2021 |date=July 27, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://deathpenaltyinfo.org/news/delaware-prosecutor-suspended-for-misconduct-in-capital-trial |title=Delaware Prosecutor Suspended for Misconduct in Capital Trial |website=deathpenaltyinfo.org |publisher=[[Death Penalty Information Center]] |access-date=July 26, 2021 |date=July 29, 2015}}</ref> On remand, McCoy was acquitted on all charges after a bench trial.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.delawareonline.com/story/news/crime/2017/01/19/not-guilty-former-death-row-inmate-go-free/96786930/ |title=Former death row inmate goes free after acquittal |first=Jessica Masulli |last=Reyes |newspaper=[[The News Journal]] |location=[[Wilmington, Delaware]] |access-date=July 26, 2021 |date=January 19, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |first=Maurice |last=Possley |url=https://www.law.umich.edu/special/exoneration/Pages/casedetail.aspx?caseid=5081 |title=Isaiah McCoy |publisher=[[National Registry of Exonerations]] |website=www.law.umich.edu |access-date=July 26, 2021 |date=February 3, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://deathpenaltyinfo.org/news/isaiah-mc-coy-exonerated-from-delaware-death-row-the-157th-death-row-exoneration-since-1973 |title=Isaiah McCoy Exonerated from Delaware Death Row, the 157th Death Row Exoneration Since 1973 |website=deathpenaltyinfo.org |publisher=Death Penalty Information Center |access-date=July 26, 2021 |date=January 20, 2017}}</ref>
